Authors: Mahardhika F., Warnars H.L.H.S., Heryadi Y., Lukas
Title: Indonesian's Dangdut Music Classification Based on Audio Features
Source title: 1st 2018 Indonesian Association for Pattern Recognition International Conference, INAPR 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Computer Science Departement, BINUS Graduate Program - Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Faculty of Engineering, Cognitive Engineering Research Group (CERG), Universitas Katolik Atma Jaya, Jakarta, 12930, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Mahardhika, F., Computer Science Departement, BINUS Graduate Program - Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Warnars, H.L.H.S., Computer Science Departement, BINUS Graduate Program - Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Heryadi, Y., Computer Science Departement, BINUS Graduate Program - Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Lukas, Faculty of Engineering, Cognitive Engineering Research Group (CERG), Universitas Katolik Atma Jaya, Jakarta, 12930, Indonesia
Abstract: The uniqueness of modern dangdut music today is in the beat and melody of music that is relatively faster like techno dance music, and the progressive melody arrangement from synthesizer keyboard. In this paper, we will extract audio features from music, and then used that features for classification based on machine learning methods. Support Vector Machine (SVM) was used in this study. In this paper's experiment we use 32 audio music files, consisting of 16 for dangdut music and 16 for techno dance music. The results of this testing get varying accuracy levels, between 80% to 90% for each music audio file that has been successfully classified. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: dangdut music classification; machine learning; Support Vector Machine
Index Keywords: Classification (of information); Learning systems; Machine learning; Pattern recognition; Support vector machines; Accuracy level; Audio features; Audio files; Audio music; Music classification; On-machines; Audio acoustics

Authors: Budhi Y.W., Devianto H., Mahardhika F., Ignacia L., Mikhael H.A.
Title: Fluid dynamics and kinetic simulation for steam reforming of ethanol using a microchannel reactor
Source title: Proceedings of 2014 International Conference on Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, ICEECS 2014
Affiliations: Dept. of Chemical Engineering, Institut Teknologi Bandung, Bandung, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Budhi, Y.W., Dept. of Chemical Engineering, Institut Teknologi Bandung, Bandung, Indonesia; Devianto, H., Dept. of Chemical Engineering, Institut Teknologi Bandung, Bandung, Indonesia; Mahardhika, F., Dept. of Chemical Engineering, Institut Teknologi Bandung, Bandung, Indonesia; Ignacia, L., Dept. of Chemical Engineering, Institut Teknologi Bandung, Bandung, Indonesia; Mikhael, H.A., Dept. of Chemical Engineering, Institut Teknologi Bandung, Bandung, Indonesia
Abstract: Proton Exchange Membrane Fuel Cell (PEMFC) has been recognized to be the potential source for future vehicles due to environmentally friendly. Supplying hydrogen for mobile vehicles is becoming of interest since storing compressed hydrogen in the bottle is not only dangerous but also energy consuming. One way to overcome the drawback is by performing the ethanol steam reforming in situ. In this way, microreactor offers the potential benefit to convert ethanol to hydrogen due to very fast mass and heat transfer. Fluid dynamics inside the microreactors and the kinetic aspects for ethanol steam reforming using Pt/Al2O3 catalyst were investigated with aim to determine the proper microreactor design having uniform fluid distribution and to study the influence of reaction temperature, fluid velocity, and reactor length. It was found that placing an obstacle inside the microreactors in certain position gave more uniform distribution of fluid flow. The reaction temperature and fluid velocity showed their influence on hydrogen productivity. © 2014 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Computational fluid dynamic; ethanol steam reforming; kinetic; microchannel reactor; PEMFC; simulation
